definition[0]: to say something which seems to mean something unpleasant without saying it openly, especially suggesting that someone is being dishonest
example[0]: What are you trying to insinuate?
example[1]: Are you insinuating that the money was stolen?
definition[1]: to gradually gain someone’s love, trust etc by pretending to be friendly and sincere
example[2]: He managed to insinuate his way into her affections.
example[3]: He insinuated himself into Mehmet’s confidence.
definition[2]: to move yourself or a part of your body into a place
example[4]: a large cat insinuated itself through the gap
